messages.content: You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: Let me follow up with you, Vice President Biden, you've said you wouldn't meet with Kim Jong Un without preconditions. Are there any conditions under which you would meet with him?
On the condition that he would agree that he would be drawing down his nuclear capacity to get there. The Korean Peninsula should be a nuclear free zone.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.

WELKER: President Trump, we have to move on. We have a lot of questions to get through.
TRUMP: They tried to meet with him, he wouldn't do it.

We had a good relationship with Hitler before he in fact invaded Europe, the rest of Europe. Come on. The reason he would not meet with President Obama is because President Obama said we're gonna talk about denuclearization, we're not gonna legitimize you, we're gonna continue to put stronger and stronger sanctions on you. That's why he wouldn't meet with us.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: Vice President Biden, your health care plan calls for building on Obamacare. What is your plan if the law is ruled unconstitutional?

What I'm going to do is pass Obamacare with a public option — become Bidencare. Public option is an option that says that if you, in fact, do not have the wherewithal to be — if you qualify for Medicaid, and you do not have the wherewithal in your state to get Medicaid, you automatically are enrolled, providing competition for insurance companies. That's what's going to happen. Secondly, we're going to make sure we reduce the premiums and reduce drug prices by making sure that there's competition that doesn't exist now by allowing Medicare to negotiate drug prices with the insurance companies. Thirdly, the idea that I want to eliminate private insurance — the reason why I had such a fight for, with 20 candidates for the nomination, was I support private insurance. Not one single person with private insurance would lose their insurance under my plan.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: Mr. Vice President, why haven't Democrats been able to get a deal for the American people?

Well, I have and they have pushed it. Look, they passed this act all the way back in the beginning of the summer. This is like — it's not new. The HEROES Act has been sitting there. When I was in charge of the Recovery Act with $800 billion, I was able to get $145 billion to local communities to keep firefighters, teachers, and first responders working. He will not support that. Mitch McConnell said, 'Let him go bankrupt.' Come on.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: Mr. Vice President, do you think this is the right time to ask small businesses to raise the minimum wage?

I do, because I think one of the things we're gonna have to do is we're gonna have to bail them out too. One in six small businesses are going under. They're not going to be able to make it back. They need help now. Two jobs at minimum wage still put you below the poverty level. These first responders deserve a minimum wage of $15.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: Vice President Biden, why should voters trust you on immigration reform now?

Because we made a mistake. It took too long to get it right. I'll be President of the United States, not Vice President. Within 100 days, I'm going to send to Congress a pathway to citizenship for over 11 million undocumented people. Dreamers will be protected and put on a path to citizenship. We owe them.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
TRUMP: Catch and release is a disaster.

Catch and release meant families were given a court date and they showed up. This is the first President in American history that has forced asylum seekers to apply in another country. They're sitting in squalor on the other side of the river.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: Vice President Biden, do you understand why Black parents fear for their children?

I do. A Black parent, no matter how wealthy or poor, has to teach their child how to survive a police stop. That is institutional racism. We have never lived up to the promise that all men and women are created equal. We must provide economic opportunity, education, health care, and justice.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
TRUMP: Nobody has done more for the Black community than me.

The Central Park Five were innocent. He continued to push for the death penalty. He said there were not enough people in jail. We reduced the federal prison population by 38,000 people. We need to end mandatory minimums and send people to treatment, not jail.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: Vice President Biden, how would you combat climate change and create jobs?

Climate change is an existential threat. We have a moral obligation to deal with it. My plan creates millions of good-paying jobs — retrofitting buildings, building charging stations, expanding clean energy. Wall Street says my plan creates 18.6 million jobs.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
TRUMP: Would you close down the oil industry?
I would transition from the oil industry. Yes. Over time. And replace it with renewable energy. And stop giving subsidies to oil companies.
You are Joe Biden debating Donald Trump.
WELKER: What will you say to Americans who did not vote for you?

I will say I'm the American president. I represent all of you whether you voted for me or not. We'll choose science over fiction, hope over fear, decency over division. The character of this country is on the ballot.
